title: Maximum value of an intergal from derivative graph

content.question: The graph of <math> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </math>, the derivative of the function <math> <mi>f</mi> </math>, is shown above for <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow> </math>. The areas of the regions between the graph of <math> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </math> and the x-axis are 20, 6, and 4, respectively. If <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow> </math>, what is the maximum value of <math> <mi>f</mi> </math> on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow> </math>?

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
